required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: TR-701 FA vs Linezolid for the Treatment of Acute Bacterial Skin and Skin Structure Infections
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3 Randomized, Double-Blind, Multicenter Study Comparing the Efficacy and Safety of IV to Oral 6-Day TR-701 Free Acid and IV to Oral 10-Day Linezolid for the Treatment of ABSSSI

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a randomized, double-blind, double-dummy, multicenter, global Phase 3 study of IV to oral TR-701 FA 200 mg once daily for 6 days versus IV to oral Zyvox® (linezolid) 600 mg every 12 hours for 10 days for the treatment of ABSSSI in adults. Patients are to start treatment with at least 2 IV doses and may receive IV therapy for the entire treatment duration.
Approximately 100 to 140 sites globally will participate in this study. Patients with an ABSSSI caused by suspected or documented gram positive pathogen(s) at baseline will be randomized 1:1 to study treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective is to determine the noninferiority (NI) in the early clinical response rate of intravenous (IV) to oral 6 day TR-701 free acid (FA) compared with that of IV to oral 10-day linezolid treatment at 48-72 hours after the first infusion of study drug in the intent-to-treat (ITT) analysis set in patients with acute bacterial skin and skin structure infections (ABSSSI).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Responder: No increase in lesion surface area from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response at the End of Therapy Visit
secondary_outcome.description: Responder: No increase in lesion surface area from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Response at the End of Therapy Visit in the Clinically Evaluable at End of Therapy Analysis Set
secondary_outcome.description: Responder: No increase in lesion surface area from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Investigator's Assessment of Clinical Success at the Post Treatment Evaluation Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post-Treatment Evaluation (7-14 days after the End of Therapy)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical success defined as resolution/near resolution of disease specific signs and symptoms, absence/near resolution of baseline systemic signs of infection, and no further antibiotic therapy required for treatment of primary ABSSSI lesion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Investigator's Assessment of Clinical Success of the Post Therapy Evaluation Visit in Clinically Evaluable-Post Treatment Evaluation Analysis Set.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Post-Treatment Evaluation (7-14 days after the End of Therapy)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical success defined as resolution/near resolution of disease specific signs and symptoms, absence/near resolution of baseline systemic signs of infection, no new signs, symptoms or complications attributable to the ABSSSI and no further antibiotic therapy required for treatment of primary ABSSSI lesion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Investigator's Assessment of Clinical Response at the 48-72 Hour Visit
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical improvement defined as improvement in overall clinical status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Investigator's Assessment of Clinical Response at the Day-7 Visit
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical improvement defined as improvement in overall clinical status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Patient-reported Pain, by Study Visit
secondary_outcome.description: 0=no pain, 10=worst pain Only 1 visit per participant for Day 4-6, only 1 visit for Day 7-9, and only 1 visit for Day 10-13.

clinical_study.condition: Skin and Subcutaneous Tissue Bacterial Infections

arm_group.description: • TR-701 FA IV followed by TR-701 FA tablets
• Linezolid IV followed by Linezolid Tablets

intervention.description: TR-701 FA 200 mg once daily in 250 mL sterile saline for injection as a 60 minute IV infusion TR-701 FA Tablets, 200 mg, orally once daily
Linezolid 600 mg IV Injection twice daily in 300 mL sterile saline for injection as a 60 minute IV infusion Linezolid Tablets, 600 mg, orally every 12 hours

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients requiring IV antibiotic therapy and with systemic signs of infection diagnosed with ABSSSI.
- Diagnosed with Cellulitis/ erysipelas, major cutaneous abscess, or wound infections
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncomplicated skin infections
- Severe sepsis or septic shock
- ABSSSI solely due to gram-negative pathogens

clinical_study.keyword: Acute Bacterial Skin and Skin Structure Infections

group.title: Tedizolid Phosphate
group.description: IV to oral tedizolid phosphate 200 mg once daily for 6 days followed by 4 days of placebo.

group.title: Linezolid
group.description: IV to oral linezolid 600 mg twice daily for 10 days.

group.description: IV to oral tedizolid phosphate 200 mg once daily for six days followed by four days of placebo.

group.description: IV to oral linezolid 600 mg twice daily for 10 days.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: The Early Clinical Response Rate
outcome.description: Responder: No increase in lesion surface area from baseline.
outcome.population: The Intent to Treat analysis set includes data from all randomized participants.

group.title: Tedizolid Phosphate
group.description: IV to oral tedizolid phosphate 200 mg once daily for six days followed by four days of placebo.

group.title: Linezolid
group.description: IV to oral linezolid 600 mg twice daily for 10 days.

measure.title: The Early Clinical Response Rate
measure.description: Responder: No increase in lesion surface area from baseline.
measure.population: The Intent to Treat analysis set includes data from all randomized participants.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: A two-sided 95% CI was calculated for the observed differences in the early clinical response rates at 48 to 72 Hours after the first infusion of study drug using the method of Miettinen and Nurminen without stratification. Noninferiority was concluded if the lower limit of the 95% CI was greater than -10%.
analysis.estimate_desc: Risk difference corresponds to the tedizolid responder rate minus the linezolid responder rate.

outcome.title: Clinical Response at the End of Therapy Visit
outcome.description: Responder: No increase in lesion surface area from baseline.
outcome.population: The Intent to Treat analysis set includes data from all randomized participants.

group.title: Tedizolid Phosphate
group.description: IV to oral tedizolid phosphate 200 mg once daily for 6 days followed by 4 days of placebo.

group.title: Linezolid
group.description: IV to oral linezolid 600 mg twice daily for 10 days.

measure.title: Clinical Response at the End of Therapy Visit
measure.description: Responder: No increase in lesion surface area from baseline.
measure.population: The Intent to Treat analysis set includes data from all randomized participants.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: A two-sided 95% CI was calculated for the observed differences in the programmatic clinical response at the EOT visit using the method of Miettinen and Nurminen without stratification. Noninferiority was concluded if the lower limit of the 95% CI was greater than -10% and the conditions of the hierarchical testing procedure were met.
analysis.estimate_desc: Risk difference corresponds to the tedizolid clinical response rate minus the linezolid clinical response rate.

outcome.title: Clinical Response at the End of Therapy Visit in the Clinically Evaluable at End of Therapy Analysis Set
outcome.description: Responder: No increase in lesion surface area from baseline.
outcome.population: All randomized participants receiving minimal study therapy, completed EOT assessment, no concomitant systemic antibiotic therapy and no confounding events or factors.

group.description: IV to oral tedizolid phosphate 200 mg once daily for 6 days followed by 4 days of placebo.

group.title: Linezolid

measure.title: Clinical Response at the End of Therapy Visit in the Clinically Evaluable at End of Therapy Analysis Set
measure.description: Responder: No increase in lesion surface area from baseline.
measure.population: All randomized participants receiving minimal study therapy, completed EOT assessment, no concomitant systemic antibiotic therapy and no confounding events or factors.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: A two-sided 95% CI was calculated for the observed differences in the clinical response rate based on the Investigator's assessment of clinical response at the EOT Visit using the method of Miettinen and Nurminen without stratification. Noninferiority was concluded if the lower limit of the 95% CI was greater than -10% and the conditions of the hierarchical testing procedure were met.
analysis.estimate_desc: Risk difference corresponds to the tedizolid clinical response rate minus the linezolid clinical response rate.

outcome.description: Clinical success defined as resolution/near resolution of disease specific signs and symptoms, absence/near resolution of baseline systemic signs of infection, and no further antibiotic therapy required for treatment of primary ABSSSI lesion.
outcome.time_frame: Post-Treatment Evaluation (7-14 days after the End of Therapy)
outcome.population: The Intent to Treat analysis set includes data from all randomized participants.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor intends to pursue publication of the results of the study in cooperation with a lead Investigator, subject to the terms and conditions of the clinical study agreement between the Sponsor and Investigators. Sponsor approval in writing is required for publication of any data subsets. Final authorship will be determined in accordance with the International Committee of Medical Journal Editors definition of authorship.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Analyses for this study were conducted using 2 statistical plans, 1 for the US FDA and 1 for the EMA, to address differing guidance on the development of antibacterials. These differences are reflected in the EudraCT and clinicaltrials.gov records.
